div.p: From Crisis Response to Long-Term Partnership
Illustrative image: Shipping containers stacked high like a city skyline â€” representing the massive volume of inventory Warefor processed through rapid emergency warehousing deployment.

During the height of the pandemic, a major national big-box retailer faced severe congestion at U.S. ports. Large volumes of inbound containers were accumulating in costly storage yards, delaying inventory visibility and restricting product flow across their distribution network.

ul.li: Receive the merchandise into their systems for visibility & inventory control
Restore throughput across their supply chain under extreme time pressure

div.p: Warefor was engaged to deliver an immediate, large-scale warehousing solution with minimal lead time.

ul.li: Identified and secured a 375,000 sq. ft. warehouse on a short-term lease
Fully cleaned, prepared, and operationalized the facility
Began receiving inbound freight the day after the lease was executed

div.p: As inbound volumes continued to surge, Warefor expanded operations to manage two facilities simultaneously, totaling over 500,000 sq. ft. of active warehouse space operating at near-full capacity.

p.strong: To ensure speed, accuracy, and transparency, Warefor implemented:

ul.li: Photo-based operational reporting for real-time quality control
Proactive communication to ensure uninterrupted flow of containers
